item.value: A script you can attach on an entity to test if it is visible on a Layer
@classdesc An instance of a {@link Mesh}. A single mesh can be referenced by many mesh instances that can have different transforms and materials.
@param {RenderComponentSystem} system - The ComponentSystem that created this Component.
@classdesc Enables an Entity to render a {@link Mesh} or a primitive shape. This component attaches {@link MeshInstance} geometry to the Entity.
@classdesc The forward renderer render scene objects.
@param {string} [name] - The non-unique name of the entity, default is "Untitled".
ComponentSystems allow access to all Entities and Components and are attached to the {@link Application}.
Components are specific to an instance of an Entity and are attached (e.g. `this.entity.model`)

The Component and ComponentSystem provide the logic to give an Entity a specific type of behavior. e.g. the ability to render a model or play a sound. Components are specific to an instance of an Entity and are attached (e.g. `this.entity.model`) ComponentSystems allow access to all Entities and Components and are attached to the {@link Application}.
The Entity uniquely identifies the object and also provides a transform for position and orientation which it inherits from {@link GraphNode} so can be added into the scene graph.
Set an update function on the app's update event
destroy temporary directional lights as they are costly to keep around
Create an entity with a spot light component that is configured as a baked light
Create an entity with a omni light component that is configured as a baked light
random angle based on directionality, within 10 or 90 degrees from straight down
